intro: Psychotria longicollis, commonly known as the long-necked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
